comment: Follow the syllabus. He gives a lot of homework, but none of it felt like busywork because he assigns parts of essays at a time. The final essays benefit greatly from this process. I would highly recommend taking his classes if you're willing to work hard, because you will learn a lot if you do.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria

comment: You will do well if you: speak up, show up, and turn your work in on time. Make an effort and talk to him after/before class if you have a problem. He is a tough grader but gives good feedback and is passionate about writing. If you are serious about writing, take his class. If you want an easy A, he might not be for you.

What's good about him: he's been published-a lot (i.e. he knows something), he gives good feedback, prepares you for turning in your final portfolio. What's bad: Unclear grading criteria, obsessed with being on time, has favorites, textbook was not helpful. Also, he's super sarcastic and very expressive, so don't take what he says personally.

This was the hardest class at Kennesaw, but with a great professor. He was shady and condescending, a tough grader, and yes do the work. But I learned a lot of useful resources from him. He gave me a solid foundation to writing. As far as people skills, he got a little more work to do. If you do sign up, take the class serious otherwise good luck.!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: This class is medium hard but can be easy if you just do what you need to do. Come to class, read your books, when you are assigned essays read over the rubric and participate in class. Also, take advantage of the writing center. You'll get extra credit for it and it helps. I got an A. I don't think he is hard at all.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: I am honestly not a fan. He is not very kind, and he seems a bit condescending. He is willing to schedule conferences with students outside of class, but I am not sure I would feel comfortable because he comes off as annoyed with students. I would not recommend if you are looking to get an A.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: He doesn't give a lecture and does not know how to explain the material well.  He once talked about an annoying girl he dislikes in an entire class and told us it will be on the test. He does not give you an explanation of the grade. He will just tell you that he does not take any questions.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Rude, very tough grader and his assignments are VERY hard. Textbooks are mandatory in every class. His in class assignments aren't very clear and he doesn't finish his thoughts when he lectures. I had to withdrawal from his class because I knew I wouldn't do make better than a C or B. DO NOT take his class if you're trying to pass with a high grade
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He was a fine professor, but he is very strict on his papers. He will mark up the first page of your draft and then move on to the next student. He isn't extremely clear on his feedback. On the positive side, he is passionate about what he does and his work is always well thought out and has a purpose. Its a difficult class but you learn a lot.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: this guy defines textbook narcissism. he's very full of himself and condescending. pretty tough grader. i got an A in the course but it didn't come easily. be prepared to read a lot and make sure you have a printer because you will need to print regularly.

Both the most rewarding and hardest class ive taken but I consistently got A's on papers because I kept up with office hours. He's tough but he's brilliant and truly loves English. Don't let the difficulty scare you, you'll be fine if you meet him to look over drafts of your paper and do the readings. Takes EFFORT but if you love English take him!

Dr. Klym was an all around fantastic English professor, with office hours that truly perfected my papers and very polished lectures. His 1101 lectures really stay on topic and help your essays tremendously. He usually would have everyone do sections of the essays for homework, and then he would have us bring our work to class to fix.
not recommended. missed 2 assignments, left the class with a C.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Take Professor Klym! He does assign a lot of homework and that makes up a lot of your grade, but he only has 4 papers and gives you ample time to complete them. He extends his office hours when a paper is due and makes sure to give feedback to every student. Made class fun and engaging. If you work hard and start your papers early you can get an A.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: He just gives way too much unnecessary work. You get homework everyday and if you don't do it you'll probably fail the journal assignments. I thought this was normal for all the teachers here, but it's just him. He makes the class way more difficult than it needs to be. The 4 essays that he makes you write are all on confusing topics. Good Luck.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: This professor is a jerk. I got really sick during the semester and was in the hospital and he was super rude to me when I reached out to him for help and extensions on a paper we were writing. He's full of himself and he talks about how we have to take notes on his life. THE PAPERS ARE NOT EASY DO NOT PROCRASTINATE!!!!!!!!!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Will make you work for your grade. If you like to do essays last minute, this class will not be good for you at all he grades essays super strict.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: He is extremely full of himself & does not care about anything other than his own interests.  He acts like his class is the only class you are enrolled in & assigns an unnecessary amount of reading & dumb assignments. On the first day he will say " I will never assign busy work" but i can promise you that is a lie. Don't waste your time with this.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dr. Klym does give A's. You just have to work for it. He provides clear rubrics for all papers. It does suck if you're like me and learned to write a broad thesis in high school. Dr. Klym teaches the list-style thesis statement, and by the last paper you're thesis sentence has 6 points and is a half-page long. Follow the rubricgood grade!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Very picky when it comes to his 4 papers & final group presentation. He will pick your papers apart & mark off for minor things. Got a C on a huge paper (200 or more points) after visiting his office numerous times to avoid making anything lower than a B. He is too focused on favorite students & English has a subject in general. Take another prof.

Unless you're a strong writer or have him for an upper level English class, avoid him. Even then, he's really rude and narcissistic. Loves himself and ballet, basically. Very critical and doesn't hide it. I'll admit I learned a lot about fiction from the guy, but his attitude doesn't allow me to appreciate it.

this was the worst class i took DO NOT TAKE HIM if you can help it. His papers are not clear and they are hard for no reason. He is so self absorbed and he can be very shady when you are asking simple questions. Yes, he is a very good teacher but that is because he loves writing. If you can help it choose another teacher.

This is the worst class I have ever taken. Professor talks more about himself in class rather than the actual material. Very opinionated and only wants his example topics used for papers, no freedom to write about your own interest. Very hard grader, assignments are not clear, papers are impossible. Drop this class!
very difficult teacher/grader.  He will rarely give away an A, on anything.  I had to work hard to receive a B. Incredibly arrogant human.

Despite what many have to say about Dr. Klym, I absolutely loved him!! Yes he is a hard grader but I came out of that semester with so much knowledge about writing and improved a lot myself. He provides office hours and is EXTREMELY HELPFUL! Yes, you will work really hard but in the end you'll love him. HE'S AMAZING PLS TAKE HIM BEST PROFESSOR EVER

Dr. Klym does not in any way give anything higher than a 90. His standards are far to high, and he is very annoying when it comes to calrification on aspects you need help with on your papers. He is not compassionate at all, and he will give you a horrible grade regardless of the effort you put in. He has all of his humanity

Honestly the worst class I have ever taken I would highly recommend dropping this class immediately for any other professor. He is rude and even when I went into his office hours I did not receive a C on a paper

If you just read reviews on Klym, you are more than likely going to not want to take his class. It is true that he is a tough grader, but all you have to do is follow his essay prompts and he practiaclly lays out the structure for you. Tough teacher, but ultimately cares about making each student a better writer. Best English teacher I've ever had

Coming into college I felt awful about my writing skills.  I had never received above an 80 on a paper.  After having an awful 1101 professor, I chose to try Klym for change of pace.  While his class has been my entire life and taken all of my sleep this semester, he has made me a much better writer.  If that is your goal, take this class.
He is an extremely difficult grader and the material is difficult as well. The content he expects from you is outrageous and has too high of expectations.

I tried to come into this class with an open mind and during High School I was taught to write at a higher level (using broad thesis). For this class I was forced to write thesis points and the feedback he gave was awful. He does not use technology to the degree but instead 90% of class will be him complaining about the small whiteboard.

I took him for ENGL 1101, he's really tough but there are a ton of grades throughout the semester so one bad grade doesn't destroy your entire grade. He'll grade tough but it isn't difficult to make good grades. I got a B

I thought I was a good writer until I took his class. It's a very challenging class with semi-vague prompts, but I have learned so much about writing and organizing a good argument from his class. He does take off points for little things, but you might think you wrote an awful paper and end up with a higher grade than you expected. You must work.

Dr. Klym is a very respectable professor. However, if you didn't pass the AP exam for Literature or Language, or weren't in AP at all, do NOT take him if you can avoid him. His paper criteria is so meticulous that I felt so cornered when it came to writing my papers. It was very hard to get my ideas down on paper. He did improve my writing though.

Well, his class is pretty tough, but he is clear with what he wants. Go to his office hours and he will help you to better your essay. He grades tough and he gives way too many assignments for a first year English class, but he does ultimately make you a better writer.

His class is amazingly hard. If you're not a English major don't take it. His prompts are extremely ambiguous  and he gives a lot of work. If you have to take his class just follow the syllabus closely and show up on time everyday and try your best.
Fantastic teacher! Show up, guaranteed A.

If you are a freshman, chances are you are if you are taking this class, STAY AWAY FROM HIS CLASS You will have so many assignments that you may think 1101 is the only thing you have for the whole semester. And you need to do everything PERFECTLY even for a chance to get a B. STAY AWAY IF YOU LIKE YOUR GPA

This professor is the worst instructor I ever had. He marked off for the smallest detail in my essays, did not give me credit for doing my assignment even though I did do it, and gave me a phone infraction when I was just turning it off. If you had the choice, choose a different instructor.

This was the worst class. His assignments are confusing and he gives ALOT of work. DONT take this class if English is not your major. His notes are hard to follow and essay prompts are very confusing.

This class was THE WORST. His class was extremely difficult and he expects ALOT from you. He grades very hard and he will only let you miss three classes until he takes off points but YOU DO NOTHING BUT WASTE TIME IN THE CLASS. Most work done in class can be done at home. Hated that class!
if you are an international do not take this class, he will talk to you differently just because he thinks there is language barrier. And he is very weird.

When i took the class in the fall of 2013 i did not think that i enjoyed the class. HOWEVER, i realize now how much he imporved my writing skills. He was very helpful with crtiquing papers, and was constantly there to offer help and develop your writing skills. This class will be a hardworking B, but it will improve your writing skills tremendously

This course is way overloaded for 1102. 80% of my schoolwork comes from this class as if English would is my major. It frustrates me how there can be this much unnecessary work in such a basic level class where everything can be taught much easier.

Dr. Klym was always very rude to me, when you ask him questions he replies with a smart "allicy" tone. His prompts were difficult and he didn't offer much help to help you understand. He offers office hours but theyre ally are no help.

Hardest Professor I have ever taken. His topics are extremely hard and I didn't feel comfortable writing on some of his topics. When taken to the writing center, even they couldn't help me. He offers office hours but offers no help what so ever. I showed up everyday too and the class was still difficult for me.

Mr. Klym was a great teacher! he is so organized, I love it! very challenging, but worth it! He really grew me as a writer! His papers are pretty hard but he gives really organized guidelines and deadlines for each step!
very strict grade wise and attendance, pretty cool guy though

This professor is one of the best. He is very through and helps you to understand if you have any questions. Very engaging class. Provides excellent feedback on papers. Take advantage of his office hours! He once stayed after hours even to help me with my paper. This class is not easy to get an A, but passing is no problem! Highly recommended!

Absolutely loved his teaching style. TAKE ADVANTAGE of office hours and respect his rules. Gives you plenty of time to do papers and opportunities to get guidance. The students who didn't do as well in my class did not go to his office hours. Have a good work ethic, go to class/office hours, buy the books. TAKE HIM!I am now a much better writer.

Interesting prompts that make you think outside the box. Wants every student to succeed, go to office hours for help. Helps develop analytical thinking, learned how to be a better writer from his class. Understanding (on deadlines) and wants to hear your ideas so throw them out to him. Highly recommended!

This class is pretty easy. 4 essays during the semester and the final is an essay about how you improved as a writer throughout the semester that can be turned in before your actual final exam day. He will do anything to help his students succeed. He doesn't want anyone to fail.

Very challenging class but teaches you how to be a better writer. I improved so much, and his prompts are different, but interesting. I made an A in his class, but it was very time consuming. I enjoyed his class so much that I signed up for English 1102 with him. He really cares about his students and really helps in office hours. Take him!

Dr. Klym was my favorite professor this semester. He is very helpful and funny and just overall genuinely nice. He always answered my questions actually cared about my grade in the class. I tried to take him again for English 1102, but his class filled up too fast. If you just listen to his advice in class, you'll do great, I ended with a solid A.

Mr.Kylm is a great professor. He genuinely wishes to help is students improve and has complete faith in them. The papers gradually become more difficult and his grading becomes less lenient. Take advantage of the office hours he offers because who better to seek help from then the proffesor who will grade your paper? He's not an easy professor.

Nice teacher overall. There is constant work that usually involves some sort of paper, but if you optimize your time and ask for help when you need it, you shouldn't have a problem. In class assignments can be a little confusing, but just ask for clarification if you need it. It helps. No regrets taking this class.

He's very eccentric. He will tell you his whole life story within the first few classes, and tends to drift off topic. But he does try to help his students be the best writers possible. So many papers...but you learn so much. Also, take advantage of the office hours. He will tear apart your paper but it helps! (Buy the books, you'll need them!!)

He is a very difficult professor. He grades harsh and expects the best from his students. But he is truly a good professor and is very helpful when you go to office hours. My writing has improved drastically. Only downside is that I spend about 10 hours a week on outside work for his class. Difficult class, but I can't say I regret taking it.

Dr. Klym was an interesting teacher to have. He graded very hard, but he seemed to actually believe that his students were capable of giving him the level of work he wanted, which was nice. He was always friendly and tried really hard to connect with his students, and sometimes I felt bad for him because other students were so apathetic. Nice guy.

If you work hard and do what he says then you will be fine.  If you go to him after class and ask questions then he will tell you exactly what he wants you to do in your papers. I recommend taking this class if you are not a very experienced writer, because he will help you out tremendously.
He is such a sweet teacher!! If you do your work then you will do well. He is very helpful and if you meet with him during his office hours he will help you a lot.
As one of the few English majors (most of my co-students are Nursing majors), I found Dr. Klym to be a good teacher. He seemed very well-versed as a teacher. I found him very helpful too.

I thought he was a very good teacher. I had no problems with him. Seems to enjoy teaching and willing to help whenever I asked. His essay prompts could seem difficult at first, but after reading a few times makes sense.

He wasn?t a good teacher I didn?t learn anything from him. His notes are very unorganized and hard to follow. he is very awkward and tries to make jokes but they are not funny and his essay prompts were very confusing. DONT TAKE IS CLASS KLYM+YOU= LOW GPA

TERRIBLE professor!! Don't reccomend him at all. His notes are scattered and confusing. The prompts are pointless and hard to understand. They are very "out there." He does give a lot of feedback on papers, but is a very tough grader! He has a terrible personality and he is just awkward and terrible.

I found him very helpful, whether a quick question after class or a couple of office hour meetings. I liked his prompt, more interesting then what some of my friends in other english classes were getting, e.g. we were asked to dine at a restaurant serving an ethic food we never had before and then write about it.

Overall his class was OK. His essay prompts are extremely confusing. His notes are scattered and sometimes are really confusing. There were some essay prompts where I had no idea what he wanted. He is a strict grader but gives feedback on essays. I am definitely not taking his class again and if I were you I wouldn't either. AVOID!!

I really liked him as a professor. I am taking him next semester as well. The prompts do make you think a bit more however, majority of them are interesting. I personally really like the textbook. He does get off topic at times but overall he tells you what you need to do in order to get a good grade in the class. Always open to helping with essays

He plays favorites big time, and is horrible at giving notes. His class is so confusing and his prompts make little to no sense. I like him as a person, but as a teacher I would not recommend his class!!
